ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's way more interesting than it sounds, try it!
I strongly recommend it to a fellow student not only because it fulfills the requirement for degree but also you learn a lot.
It is a historiography class, focused not on discussing the validity of what an author says, but instead discussing what the author actually said. I would recommend this to a fellow student.

I would recommend it for those who are interested specifically in the subject, but would warn that the seminar is dominated by International Relations' students which affects the historical depth of the seminar.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It deepened my knowledge on why the historical approach is important.
It gave me a better understanding of some of the classic texts that I had previously read.
This seminar contributed more to my orals preparations and general historical knowledge than to my research per se. I believe I have a better understanding now of international history.
